texts.text: We are changing ranked play bans to 1 ban per player before drafting. All bans are made within a period of 30 seconds. Bans can overlap, similar to how bans work in League of Legends.
subtexts: A case discussed was the possibility of having all tanks banned in a match but first consider that we have 13 characters that can play the Tank role which is the role with least possible heroes AND now consider that IN FACT 10 bans on tanks that don't overlap need to happen. And don't forget that the bans are for both teams and they would have less tank options.

texts.text: Changing the current pick order to 1L-2R-2L-2R-2L-1R (L: Left team, R: Right team).

general.developerCommentary: We are not going to have a good ban section in Heroes of the Storm as players could think differently during the planning stage and bans might not target the correct hero. Therefore, the general approach tested by League of Legends seems to be a good solution for this case, making it easier for everyone to provide their opinion.

texts.text: Max group size for ranked play is 2 players.

general.developerCommentary: The comeback of team league for a game that few regions still have a considerable amount of players is not a good one. Besides, queuing for matches in big groups can cause disruptions in the game experience. Even though you lose more ELO, it still feels frustrating to play against groups, making it easy for boosting a player's account with smurfs. For this reason, we are decreasing the group sizes. In my opinion, even playing as a duo can still be frustrating, but to preserve the social aspect, we are still allowing it.

texts.text: We are decreasing the max ELO you can restart a season with to Platinum 1: 500 points.

general.developerCommentary: We want to recover some of the integrity of the leaderboard ranking by not preserving old accounts' MMR ELO so highly and updating the top leaderboard only with those who truly play the game.

texts.text: Every new season, you will be demoted two tiers without the need to make placements.
If you were Platinum 3, you will be placed at Platinum 5. If you were Master, you will be placed at Platinum 1, 500 points in contrast to the ranked cap.
The first 10 games you play will reward a bonus of +200 points per victory or -200 extra losing points.

general.developerCommentary: This change reflects my perspective on MMR points. I see placement matches in every game as somewhat useless, serving only to create hype under the premise that you could achieve a higher ELO. I believe that ranked systems should be more consistent than hyped, and for that reason, having a system that always works the same and has no mystery integrates a better integrity system.

texts.text: Elo will decay will be changed based on you current elo up to lower elos.
subtexts:: Reducing extra grace period days from grandmaster/master to 3 days
Reducing inactive days before decay from grandmaster to 7
Reducing inactive days before decay from master to 10
Reducing inactive days before decay from diamond to 15
Reducing Diamond extra grace period days to 7
Platinum will start decaying on 25 days, 10 days extra grace periods
Gold will start decaying on 35 days, 15 days extra grace periods

texts.text: Elo decay will be more agressive on higher the elo

general.developerCommentary: I want to make it harder to be on greater ranks to not play or either hold a great amount of smurfs.
